instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: Macbook pro 2010 ddr3L
threads.message:
Somebody tried to upgrade Macbook pro 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> to 16GB ram ddr 3L? Should it works? The ram I tried 1.35V 10666 G.SKILL

I tried and sometimes reboot and sometimes black screen and I am not sure if this is board problem (known cap issue) or ram problem.

threads.title: Macbook pro 2010 ddr3L
threads.message: No idea really. <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> should be replaced anyway.

threads.title: Macbook pro 2010 ddr3L
threads.message: 2010 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> support only 8500??
